WorkItem.Description: As the title suggest, please can an export facility other than XML be added please, for the less technical of us. I use this extensively in Rawr2
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request.Charts] Export to CSV, Lootplan etc

Comments.Message:
Makes sense to export as XML since you can pretty much convert XML to anything you want via an XSLT transform. Although I'll grannt you that creating an XSLT file takes a bit of XML knowledge.  But it's not that hard, there's good and easy to follow tutorials out there.

Additionaly, most modern spreadsheets will happily open an XML for you and offer means to order the information in the way you want.

The problem with supporting other formats is the obvious "what other formats are we supposed to support?".  Why lootplan and not some other mod as well.

XSLT transform, I don't even know what that is. Rawr is an application for more that programmers (I hope). Rawr2 had an export to CSV function as well as Lootplan, and I dont know of any other mods like Lootplan. If I have to learn XSLT whatever then I will probably stop using rawr for loot lists and the like. Excel is a good tool for low tech users (like me).
Rawr3 will support the same exports as Rawr2.

Lootplan has not been updated for more than a year, and the project manager has not shown any appearance on Curse.com for that long. I wonder if there was an alternative? Would it be possible to export as something compatible with the Atlasloot "Wish List"?

(lootplan is still working, but for how long?)
If it stops working I'll probably fix it myself, because that's what I'm using.
@Kavan: I will remind you of that if it does stop,... cause I use it a lot too.
